search_parameters.q: Academic Careers and Vocational Choices of Elite and Non-Elite Students at an Elite College Goldstein, Michael S. Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: Academic Careers and Vocational Choices of Elite and Non-Elite Students at an Elite College Goldstein, Michael S. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Academic careers and vocational choices of elite and non-elite students at an elite college
organic_results.snippet: The aim of this study was to evaluate the effects of social class on the academic careers and vocational choices of male students at an" elite" college. Freshmen and seniors whose family backgrounds could be classified as working-class were compared with those who were classified as upper middle-class. We hypothesized the latter group to be representative of the institution's norms. The results were consistent in showing no differences between the working-class and upper middle-class students in terms of major subject, grades, plans for …

publication_info.summary: MS Goldstein - Sociology of Education, 1974 - JSTOR
